title: Which Casio scientific calculators are allowed in the IGCSE mathematics exam? - Quora
tags: International General Certificate of Secondary Education (IGCSE)

response.answer_text: All Casio calculators are allowed in GCSE exams, providing you have no programs stored in the memory. If the case has formulae written inside, you must not take the case into the exam. You are allowed to program your calculator during the exam, if you see that as a good use of your time. It's a GCSE, not rocket science! Just make sure you've had plenty of practice with the same calculator.

It depends my friend, as yk there are two parts of maths paper, however as far as i remember, you're allowed a scientific calculator for IGCSE maths and not OLEVELS math, so you can bring your calculator, good luck!!
